In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's the definition of the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)  # Split text into words
    wrapped_text = ""         # Initialize empty string for wrapped text

    for word in words
        # If adding the current word would exceed the max width
        if length(wrapped_text) + length(word) > text_width
            # Add a newline and append the current word
            wrapped_text *= "\n$word"
        else
            # Append the current word to the wrapped text
            wrapped_text *= " $word"
        end
    end

    return wrapped_text
end
```

Here's an example usage of the `wrap_string` function:

```julia
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)

println(wrapped_text)
```

This will output a wrapped version of the input text, respecting the given `text_width`.
